intro.p: Converts the elements in one of the input table's columns into an internal format (IndigoReactionCell), which can then be rendered as reaction or used for further computations. The target column must contain string representations of reaction (RDF, Smiles, CML).
This node uses Indigo classes to parse and display structures.

fullDescription.option: The column that contains the reactions.
Appends a new reaction column (with the name as specified in the text field) if checked, replaces the original column otherwise.
Treat the "X" atoms in Rxnfiles as pseudoatoms, not as "any halogen" query atoms
Ignore incorrectly specified stereochemistry on input structures, rather than sending the structures with stereochemistry errors to the "invalid reactions" table.

ports.outPort: Table with the successfully parsed reactions
Table with the reactions that parsed with errors
